lines.text: ...I am the Prince of Donegal and nobody's servant!
The Queen does not bluff. She's a politician, yes, but she's a realist. She'd hang her grandmother if she was a threat to the crown.

[to Henry about crossdressing to escape capture]
You spenta lot of time chasing everything in skirts. Now you'll know how it feels.

[to Henry]
Free? We're about as free as foxes gone to earth in a hunt.
My father taught me that victory goes to him that takes the greatest risk.
